spec.description: ClusterSyncSpec defines the desired state of ClusterSync

status.description: ClusterSyncStatus defines the observed state of ClusterSync

conditions.description: Conditions is a list of conditions associated with syncing to the cluster.

lastProbeTime.description: LastProbeTime is the last time we probed the condition.

lastTransitionTime.description: LastTransitionTime is the last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.

message.description: Message is a human-readable message indicating details about the last transition.

reason.description: Reason is a unique, one-word, CamelCase reason for the condition's last transition.

status.description: Status is the status of the condition.

type.description: Type is the type of the condition.

controlledByReplica.description:
ControlledByReplica indicates which replica of the hive-clustersync StatefulSet is responsible
for (the CD related to) this clustersync. Note that this value indicates the replica that most
recently handled the ClusterSync. If the hive-clustersync statefulset is scaled up or down, the
controlling replica can change, potentially causing logs to be spread across multiple pods.

firstSuccessTime.description: FirstSuccessTime is the time we first successfully applied all (selector)syncsets to a cluster.

selectorSyncSets.description: SelectorSyncSets is the sync status of all of the SelectorSyncSets for the cluster.

failureMessage.description:
FailureMessage is a message describing why the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet could not be applied. This is only
set when Result is Failure.

firstSuccessTime.description: FirstSuccessTime is the time when the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet was first successfully applied to the cluster.

lastTransitionTime.description: LastTransitionTime is the time when this status last changed.

name.description: Name is the name of the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet.

observedGeneration.description: ObservedGeneration is the generation of the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet that was last observed.

resourcesToDelete.description:
ResourcesToDelete is the list of resources in the cluster that should be deleted when the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet
is deleted or is no longer matched to the cluster.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion is the Group and Version of the resource.

kind.description: Kind is the Kind of the resource.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource.

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of the resource.

result.description: Result is the result of the last attempt to apply the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet to the cluster.

syncSets.description: SyncSets is the sync status of all of the SyncSets for the cluster.

failureMessage.description:
FailureMessage is a message describing why the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet could not be applied. This is only
set when Result is Failure.

firstSuccessTime.description: FirstSuccessTime is the time when the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet was first successfully applied to the cluster.

lastTransitionTime.description: LastTransitionTime is the time when this status last changed.

name.description: Name is the name of the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet.

observedGeneration.description: ObservedGeneration is the generation of the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet that was last observed.

resourcesToDelete.description:
ResourcesToDelete is the list of resources in the cluster that should be deleted when the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet
is deleted or is no longer matched to the cluster.

apiVersion.description: APIVersion is the Group and Version of the resource.

kind.description: Kind is the Kind of the resource.

name.description: Name is the name of the resource.

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of the resource.

result.description: Result is the result of the last attempt to apply the SyncSet or SelectorSyncSet to the cluster.

exampleYAML:
apiVersion: hiveinternal.openshift.io/v1alpha1
kind: ClusterSync
metadata:
  name: example-clustersync
  namespace: default
